ns1:DomainModel.projectDescription: caIntegrator application is based on this clinical genomic domain model; this model contains study, protocol, specimen and finding information.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Genomic Annotations associated with a Design Element

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: The specific starting physical location of the reporter on a chromosome, measured in base pairs
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: startPhysicalLocation

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The location of a feature (for example a SNP, repeat, etc.) relative to the coding sequence of a gene. Valid values would be upstream, 5' untranslated region, exon, intron, 3' untranslated region, downstream.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: The specific ending physical location of the reporter on a chromosome, measured in base pairs
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: endPhysicalLocation

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.

The location of a feature (for example a SNP, repeat, etc.) relative to the coding sequence of a gene. Valid values would be upstream, 5' untranslated region, exon, intron, 3' untranslated region, downstream.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: unique identifier for instance for GeneReporterAnnotation
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
Chromosomal bands observed after staining with specific dyes. The band pattern is the result of differential interactions between the dye and nonadjacent chromosomal regions.

ns2:UMLAttribute.description: The numeric or letter designation of a chromosome. Autosomes are usually indicated by numbers and sex chromosomes by letters.
ns2:UMLAttribute.name: chromosome

ns2:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.

ns3:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ns4:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A Design Element that represents some biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. The derived data from the measured data of its Features represents the presence or absence of the biosequence or biosequences it is reporting on in the BioAssay. Reporters are Identifiable and several Features on the same array can be mapped to the same reporter as can Features from a different ArrayDesign. The granularity of the Reporter's independence is dependent on the technology and the intent of the ArrayDesign. Oligos using mature technologies can in general be assumed to be safely replicated on many features where as with PCR Products there might be the desire for quality assurence to make reporters one to one with features and use the mappings to CompositeSequences for replication purposes.

ns5:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An explanatory or critical comment that has been added to a text.

ns1:UMLClass.description: A GeneBiomarker is a gene based biological parameter that is indicative of a physiological or pathological state. For example, EBBR2 is a biomarker used to identify risk of breast cancer.

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Chromosomal bands observed after staining with specific dyes. The band pattern is the result of differential interactions between the dye and nonadjacent chromosomal regions.

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: A unique gene name approved by the Human Genome Organization's Nomenclature Committee.
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: hugoGeneSymbol

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A unique gene name approved by an organism specific nomenclature committee.

An international organization of scientists involved in human genetics. Established in 1989 by a collection of the world's leading human geneticists, the primary ethos of the Human Genome Organisation is to promote and sustain international collaboration in the field of human genetics.

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: The specific starting physical location of the reporter on a chromosome, measured in base pairs
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: startPhyscialLocation

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The location of a feature (for example a SNP, repeat, etc.) relative to the coding sequence of a gene. Valid values would be upstream, 5' untranslated region, exon, intron, 3' untranslated region, downstream.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: The numeric or letter designation of a chromosome. Autosomes are usually indicated by numbers and sex chromosomes by letters.
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: chromosome

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: unique identifier for the instance of GeneBiomarker.
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
A unique gene name within a specific repository, database, or collection.

Entrez, the Life Sciences Search Engine, integrates the scientific literature, DNA and protein sequence databases, 3D protein structure and protein domain data, population study datasets, expression data, assemblies of complete genomes, and taxonomic information into a tightly interlinked system. It is a product of the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI).

ns6:UMLAttribute.description: The specific ending physical location of the reporter on a chromosome, measured in base pairs
ns6:UMLAttribute.name: endPhysicalLocation

ns6:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.

The location of a feature (for example a SNP, repeat, etc.) relative to the coding sequence of a gene. Valid values would be upstream, 5' untranslated region, exon, intron, 3' untranslated region, downstream.

ns7:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc

ns8:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ns1:UMLClass.description: A Design Element that represents some biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences; eg: Affymetrix probeset or cDNA clone (Note: may not be equivalent to a MAGE-OM Reporter in all cases.)

ns9:UMLAttribute.description: An enumeration of Design Element types that represents some biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences; eg: Affymetrix probeset or cDNA clone
ns9:UMLAttribute.name: type

ns9:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns9:UMLAttribute.description: Identifier for the reporter: eg: Affymetrix probeset ID, Image clone ID
ns9:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns9:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns10:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The transcription of genetic information into a message and the subsequent translation into a functional protein.

ns11:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A Design Element that represents some biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. The derived data from the measured data of its Features represents the presence or absence of the biosequence or biosequences it is reporting on in the BioAssay. Reporters are Identifiable and several Features on the same array can be mapped to the same reporter as can Features from a different ArrayDesign. The granularity of the Reporter's independence is dependent on the technology and the intent of the ArrayDesign. Oligos using mature technologies can in general be assumed to be safely replicated on many features where as with PCR Products there might be the desire for quality assurence to make reporters one to one with features and use the mappings to CompositeSequences for replication purposes.

ns1:UMLClass.description: An elaboration of the sequence of chemical reactions leading from one compound to another taking place in living tissue._A statement or an account describing something._Value Domain for java language String datatype.

ns12:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns12:UMLAttribute.description: unique identifier for the instance of Pathway.
ns12:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns12:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns13:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A set or series of interactions, often forming a network, which biologists have found useful to group together for organizational, historic, biophysical, or other reasons.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Alternative gene symbol to the official HUGO gene symbol

ns14:UMLAttribute.description: The gene alias name which is an alternative to the official HUGO gene symbol
ns14:UMLAttribute.name: alias

ns14:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A unique gene name within a specific repository, database, or collection.
Available in place of something else.

ns14:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns14:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns14:UMLAttribute.description: A unique gene name approved by the Human Genome Organization's Nomenclature Committee.
ns14:UMLAttribute.name: hugoGeneSymbol

ns14:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: An international organization of scientists involved in human genetics. Established in 1989 by a collection of the world's leading human geneticists, the primary ethos of the Human Genome Organisation is to promote and sustain international collaboration in the field of human genetics.
A unique gene name approved by an organism specific nomenclature committee.

ns15:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: This object describes the gene alias. (NCICB)

ns1:UMLClass.description: The Gene Ontology (GO) project is a collaborative effort to address the need for consistent descriptions of gene products in different databases. The goal of the Gene Ontology project is to produce a controlled vocabulary that can be applied to all organisms even as knowledge of gene and protein roles in cells is accumulating and changing. GO provides three structured networks of defined terms, molecular function, biological process, and cellular component, to describe gene product attributes. (from http://www.geneontology.org/):A word or expression used for some particular thing._The words or language units by which a thing is known._Value Domain for java language String datatype.

ns16:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns17:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A word or expression used for some particular thing.

ns18:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The Gene Ontology (GO) project is a collaborative effort to address the need for consistent descriptions of gene products in different databases. The goal of the Gene Ontology project is to produce a controlled vocabulary that can be applied to all organisms even as knowledge of gene and protein roles in cells is accumulating and changing. GO provides three structured networks of defined terms, molecular function, biological process, and cellular component, to describe gene product attributes. (from http://www.geneontology.org/)

ns1:UMLClass.description: The accession number is the unique identifier assigned to the entire sequence record when the record is submitted to GenBank.

ns19:UMLAttribute.description: unique identifier for the instance of GenBankAccession
ns19:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns19:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns19:UMLAttribute.description: The GenBank accession number is a combination of letters and numbers that are usually in the format of one letter followed by five digits (e.g., M12345) or two letters followed by six digits (e.g., AC123456).
ns19:UMLAttribute.name: number

ns19:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

ns19:UMLAttribute.name: hugoGeneSymbol

ns20:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A control number unique to an object, used to identify it among the other objects in a collection.

ns21:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The NIH genetic sequence database, an annotated collection of all publicly available DNA sequences. GenBank records are annotated using a standard set of biological terms and show these annotations in a Feature Table.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Variation reporter is a design element which is used to report change (variation) - alteration, deletion, or rearrangement - in the DNA sequence .

The derived data from the measured data of its Features represents the presence or absence of the biosequence or biosequences it is reporting on in the BioAssay. Reporters are Identifiable and several Features on the same array can be mapped to the same reporter as can Features from a different ArrayDesign. The granularity of the Reporter's independence is dependent on the technology and the intent of the ArrayDesign. Oligos using mature technologies can in general be assumed to be safely replicated on many features where as with PCR Products there might be the desire for quality assurence to make reporters one to one with features and use the mappings to CompositeSequences for replication purposes.

ns31:UMLAttribute.name: genomeBuild

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
The complete genetic material of an organism.

Established in 1988 as a national resource for molecular biology information, NCBI creates public databases, conducts research in computational biology, develops software tools for analyzing genome data, and disseminates biomedical information - all for the better understanding of molecular processes affecting human health and disease. (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/)

ns31:UMLAttribute.name: referenceStrand

ns31:UMLAttribute.name: dbsnpBuild

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The Single Nucleotide Polymorphism database (dbSNP) is a database repository and internet resource for a broad collection of simple genetic polymorphisms. It is hosted by the National Center for Biotechnology Information.
Version; something a little different from others of the same type; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

ns31:UMLAttribute.description: identifier for the SNP in the NCBI dbSNP database
ns31:UMLAttribute.name: dbsnpId

ns31:UMLAttribute.description: offset in number of bases of the mapped location of the SNP relative to the reference nucleotide sequence of the chromosome
ns31:UMLAttribute.name: chromosomeLocation

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ns31:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns31:UMLAttribute.description: reference nucleotide sequence used to descibe the SNP
ns31:UMLAttribute.name: referenceSequence

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The sequence of nucleotide residues along a DNA chain.
Something referred to; the object of a reference.

ns31:UMLAttribute.description: Unique string identifier assigned to each SNP for internal use by the CGEMS project
ns31:UMLAttribute.name: secondaryIdentifier

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns31:UMLAttribute.description: the area of the gene containing or adjacent to the SNP, if any. Value include: 5' UTR, 3' UTR, CDS, RNA, GENE, PSEUDO (see NCBI assembly for more information)
ns31:UMLAttribute.name: geneLocation

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

Sequences on the 3' end of messenger RNAs that are not translated into protein. The 3'UTR is involved in many post-transcriptional regulatory pathways, including regulating translation efficiency, mRNA stability, and polyadenylation signals.

Sequences on the 5' end of messenger RNAs that are not translated into protein. 5'UTR extends from the transcription start site to just before the ATG translation initiation codon. This region contains the ribosome binding site and other transcription and translation regulating sequences.
The sequences on a gene or messenger RNA that are translated into protein.

A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

Nonfunctional DNA sequences that are very similar to the sequences of known genes. Many seem to have arisen as functional gene duplications that subsequently underwent mutation and loss of function. Others are structurally similar to mRNA and seem to have arisen by a reverse transcription event followed by integration into the genome. Some pseudogenes are transcribed and may play a role in regulation of its homologous gene.

A nucleic acid molecule similar to DNA but containing ribose rather than deoxyribose. RNA is formed upon a DNA template. There are several classes of RNA molecules. They play crucial roles in protein synthesis and other cell activities. (MedicineNet.com)

ns31:UMLAttribute.description: name of the chromosome where the SNP has been mapped
ns31:UMLAttribute.name: chromosomeName

ns31:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

One of the bodies (normally 46 in humans) in the cell nucleus that is the bearer of genes, has the form of a delicate chromatin filament during interphase, contracts to form a compact cylinder segmented into two arms by the centromere during metaphase and anaphase stages of cell division, and is capable of reproducing its physical and chemical structure through successive cell divisions. In microbes, the chromosome is prokaryotic, not being enclosed within a nuclear membrane and not being subject to a mitotic mechanism.

ns36:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

ns37:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Molecular; relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.

ns1:UMLClass.description: A class describing counts and characteristics of alleles and genotypes for SNP polymorphisms observed in a CGEMS population.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: Count of the observed heterogyzote genotypes at a given locus and population
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: heterozygoteCount

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Having two different allelic form of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.
To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: Minor allele frequency or the frequency of the least frequent allele at a given SNP locus and population
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: minorAlleleFrequency

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.
The ratio of the number of observations in a statistical category to the total number of observations.
Lesser or smaller in amount, extent, or size.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: Count of genotypes that could not be determined for a given locus and population
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: missingGenotypeCount

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The genetic constitution of an organism or cell, as distinct from its expressed features or phenotype.
Not existing; not able to be found.
To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: Count of the genotypes homogygous for the reference allele at a given locus and population
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: referenceHomogyzoteCount

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Something referred to; the object of a reference.
Having two identical allelic form of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.
To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: Count of the genotypes homogygous for the non-reference allele at a given locus and population
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: otherHomogygoteCount

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Having two identical allelic form of a gene, one inherited from each parent, on each of the two homologous chromosomes.
To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.
Not otherwise specified.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: An arbitrary allele at the given locus that is considered the non-reference allele.
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: otherAllele

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Not otherwise specified.
one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: Count of alleles that could not be determined for a given locus and population
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: missingAlleleCount

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.
To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.
Not existing; not able to be found.

ns38:UMLAttribute.name: referenceAlleleCount

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.
one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.
Something referred to; the object of a reference.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: statistical measure of probability of the observed genotype frequencies deviate from Hard-Wienberg proportions
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: hardyWeinbergPValue

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The ratio of genotype frequencies that evolve when mating is random and neither selection nor drift are operating. For two alleles (A and a) with frequencies p and q, there are three genotypes: AA, Aa, and aa. The Hardy-Weinberg ratio for the three is: p^2AA : 2pqAa : q^2aa. Deviation from this ratio indicates that some force is acting on the population (e.g., selection, mutation, migration, genetic drift, non-random mating).
A measure of the probability that a result happened by chance. The lower the p-value, the more likely it is that the result was caused by treatment.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: An arbitrary allele at the given locus that is considered the reference allele
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: referenceAllele

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.
Something referred to; the object of a reference.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: Unique identifier for the instance of SNPFrequencyFinding.
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns38:UMLAttribute.description: Count of the non-reference alleles observed at a given locus and population
ns38:UMLAttribute.name: otherAlleleCount

ns38:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.
Not otherwise specified.
one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.

ns39:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

ns40:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A variation of a single nucleotide at a specific location of the genome due to base substitution, present at an appreciable frequency between individuals of a single interbreeding population.

ns41:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The ratio of the number of observations in a statistical category to the total number of observations.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Statistical results of evidence for or against genetic association between the phenotypes analyzed at a particular SNP.

ns42:UMLAttribute.description: statistical significance of the SNP association finding

ns42:UMLAttribute.description: rank of the statistical significance of the SNP association finding relative to the other findings, order by most to least significant
ns42:UMLAttribute.name: rank

ns42:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A relative status as compared to others within a group.

ns52:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.

ns53:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A variation of a single nucleotide at a specific location of the genome due to base substitution, present at an appreciable frequency between individuals of a single interbreeding population.

ns1:UMLClass.description: Bacterial Artificial Chromosome (BAC) Clone Reporter is a Design Element which is used to report on some biosequence or biosequences

ns54:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns55:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Clone; a group of genetically identical cells, organisms, or DNA molecules.

ns56:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A Design Element that represents some biological material (clone, oligo, etc.) on an array which will report on some biosequence or biosequences. The derived data from the measured data of its Features represents the presence or absence of the biosequence or biosequences it is reporting on in the BioAssay. Reporters are Identifiable and several Features on the same array can be mapped to the same reporter as can Features from a different ArrayDesign. The granularity of the Reporter's independence is dependent on the technology and the intent of the ArrayDesign. Oligos using mature technologies can in general be assumed to be safely replicated on many features where as with PCR Products there might be the desire for quality assurence to make reporters one to one with features and use the mappings to CompositeSequences for replication purposes.

ns57:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Based upon the natural F plasmid of E. coli. Inserts up to 300 Kb can be cloned and stably maintained as circular molecules.
